dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Kazakhstan, right? I, uh, I heard they're basically, like, banning tourists now. Making it impossible to get in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Kazakhstan, right? I, uh, I heard they're basically, like, banning tourists now. Making it impossible to get in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan has developed a QR code system for tourists. Details were shared by Minister of Tourism and Sports, Yerbol Myrzabosynov, at a government meeting. According to the minister, the new system was created to prevent cases of tourists being deceived when visiting Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What? No, A, that's, that's completely wrong. They're actually doing the opposite. They've launched this new QR code system for tourists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What? No, A, that's, that's completely wrong. They're actually doing the opposite. They've launched this new Q R code system for tourists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan has developed a QR code system for tourists.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A QR code system? To, like, prevent scams? That just screams, "Our country has a massive scamming problem!" Doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A Q R code system? To, like, prevent scams? That just screams, Our country has a massive scamming problem! Doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the minister, the new system was created to prevent cases of tourists being deceived when visiting Kazakhstan. Sometimes visiting tourists are scammed with services such as taxis, mobile connections, and currency exchange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's proactive! It's about, uh, providing safety and convenience. Every country has some issues with, like, dodgy taxis, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's proactive! It's about, uh, providing safety and convenience. Every country has some issues with, like, dodgy taxis, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but an official government QR code for everything? eSIMs, hotels, even registration? That's, uh, that's a lot of data, B.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but an official government Q R code for everything? eSIMs, hotels, even registration? That's, uh, that's a lot of data, B.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It includes access to eSIM services, hotel bookings, and essential registration information, said the minister.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's efficiency! Think of the tourist. No more haggling, no more, like, confusing currency exchanges. It’s brilliant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's efficiency! Think of the tourist. No more haggling, no more, like, confusing currency exchanges. It's brilliant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sometimes visiting tourists are scammed with services such as taxis, mobile connections, and currency exchange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Brilliant? They've only got it in four cities, and the airports are apparently, uh, begging for more funds just to implement it. Sounds like a half-baked plan to me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Brilliant? They've only got it in four cities, and the airports are apparently, uh, begging for more funds just to implement it. Sounds like a half-baked plan to me.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He noted that these QR codes have been installed in four Kazakh cities: Astana, Aktau, Turkestan, and Shymkent. Currently, airports are requesting additional funds to implement QR codes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It’s a pilot, A! And they want to scale it. That's, you know, that's ambition. Look at the numbers, like, 15 million foreign visitors last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a pilot, A! And they want to scale it. That's, you know, that's ambition. Look at the numbers, like, fifteen million foreign visitors last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To scale the initiative, support from local akimats and the Ministry of Transport is needed. ... In total, 15.3 million foreign visitors arrived in our country

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fifteen million foreign visitors, sure. But the article says, uh, only 10.4 million actually stayed more than a day. That's a big difference, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fifteen million foreign visitors, sure. But the article says, uh, only ten point four million actually stayed more than a day. That's a big difference, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Of them, 10.4 million stayed for more than one day. We classify them as foreign tourists, he added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Still, that's a massive number of actual tourists. And this system, it helps protect them, makes their experience smoother. It's, uh, it's modernizing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, that's a massive number of actual tourists. And this system, it helps protect them, makes their experience smoother. It's, uh, it's modernizing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, like, it's just government overreach wrapped in a QR code, you know? What's next? A QR code to get coffee?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, like, it's just government overreach wrapped in a Q R code, you know? What's next? A Q R code to get coffee?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: You always find the cloud in every silver lining, don't you? I think it's a smart, progressive move for their tourism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You always find the cloud in every silver lining, don't you? I think it's a smart, progressive move for their tourism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I don't know, B. Just feels like putting a digital band-aid on a bigger problem, uh, if you ask me.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I don't know, B. Just feels like putting a digital band-aid on a bigger problem, uh, if you ask me.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, I mean, it's a solution! A good one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, I mean, it's a solution! A good one.
